edu.rit.pj2

Class Tuple

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.pj2.Tuple
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanVbl, ByteVbl, CharVbl, Chunk, DoubleVbl, EmptyTuple, FloatVbl, IntVbl, LongChunk, LongVbl, ObjectArrayTuple, ObjectTuple, ShortVbl, StringVbl

    public abstract class Tuple
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Streamable
    Class Tuple is the base class for a tuple. Tuples are used to coordinate and communicate among multiple Tasks in a Parallel Java 2 Job. A tuple's fields carry content. The Tuple base class does not declare any fields; a subclass of class Tuple declares application-specific fields.

    Immutability. Every tuple object is assumed to be immutable once it has been constructed and initialized. "Immutable" means the states of the tuple's fields do not change; the states of all objects referenced by the tuple do not change; the states of all objects referenced by all objects referenced by the tuple do not change; and so on. If you need to change the contents of a tuple or any object to which the tuple refers (directly or indirectly), make a deep copy of the tuple and change the copy.

    Cloning. Tuples are cloneable. The clone() method must make a deep copy of the tuple. The base class Tuple's clone() method creates a shallow copy of the tuple. A subclass of class Tuple can use the inherited clone() method if all the subclass's fields are of primitive types; in that case, a shallow copy is the same as a deep copy. If some of the subclass's fields are objects or arrays, the subclass must override the clone() method to create a deep copy of the tuple.

    Object streaming. Tuples are streamable. A subclass of class Tuple must override the writeOut() and readIn() methods to write and read the subclass's fields. Also, a subclass of class Tuple must have a no-argument constructor; this constructor need not be public. If a tuple subclass does not provide the writeOut() method, the readIn() method, and the no-argument constructor, an exception will be thrown when an instance of that tuple subclass is read or written.

    Tuple matching. One tuple can be matched with another tuple using the match() method. The tuple upon which the match() method is called is the template. The tuple supplied as the match() method's argument is the target. The match() method succeeds and returns true if both of the following are true:

    • The target is an instance of the class returned by the template's matchClass() method or a subclass thereof.

    • The template's matchContent() method returns true when the target is passed as the argument.

    In the Tuple base class implementation, the matchClass() method returns the template's runtime class, and the matchContent() method returns true. Thus, the target will match the template merely if the target is an instance of the template's class or a subclass thereof.

    The matching algorithm for a subclass of class Tuple can be altered by overriding the matchClass() and/or matchContent() methods. A typical situation is when you want to match some fields of the template and target, and possibly ignore other fields.

    • Method Detail

      • clone

        public Object clone()
        Clone this tuple.

        The Tuple base class's clone() method returns a shallow copy of this tuple.

        Overrides:
        clone in class Object
        Returns:
        Clone of this tuple.

      • match

        public final boolean match(Tuple target)
        Match this template tuple with the given target tuple. The match() method succeeds and returns true if both of the following are true: the target is an instance of the class returned by the matchClass() method or a subclass thereof; and the matchContent() method returns true when the target is passed as the argument.
        Parameters:
        target - Target tuple.
        Returns:
        True if the tuples match, false if they don't.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if target is null.

      • matchClass

        public <T extends Tuple> Class<T> matchClass()
        Get this template tuple's matching class. In order to match this template tuple, a target tuple must be an instance of the returned class or a subclass thereof.

        The Tuple base class's matchClass() method returns the runtime class of this template tuple. If desired, a subclass can override the matchClass() method to return some other class.

        Returns:
        Matching class.

      • matchContent

        public boolean matchContent(Tuple target)
        Determine if the given target tuple's content matches this template's content. The target tuple is assumed to be an instance of this template's matching class or a subclass thereof.

        The Tuple base class's matchContent() method simply returns true. If desired, a subclass can override the matchContent() method to check the fields of this template tuple and the target tuple.

        Parameters:
        target - Target tuple.
        Returns:
        True if the target tuple's content matches this template tuple's content, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if target is null.

      • dump

        public void dump()
        Dump this tuple on the standard output stream. The first line is the name of this tuple's class. Each of the remaining lines consists of the name of a public non-static field, an equals sign, and the value of the field. This method is intended for debugging.

      • dump

        public void dump(PrintStream out)
        Dump this tuple on the given print stream. The first line is the name of this tuple's class. Each of the remaining lines consists of the name of a public non-static field, an equals sign, and the value of the field. This method is intended for debugging.
        Parameters:
        out - Print stream.

      • dump

        public void dump(PrintStream out,
        int indent)
        Dump this tuple on the given print stream at the given indent level. The first line is the name of this tuple's class. Each of the remaining lines consists of the name of a public non-static field, an equals sign, and the value of the field. This method is intended for debugging.
        Parameters:
        out - Print stream.
        indent - Indent level for fields. (The class name is not indented.)

        Parameters:
